meanings.definition: To proclaim or announce loudly or widely.
meanings.sent1: The mayor trumpeted the news of the upcoming festival to the whole town.
meanings.sent2: The band trumpeted the start of the parade with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent3: The teacher trumpeted the surprise test, much to the dismay of the students.
meanings.sent4: The headlines trumpeted the victory of the underdog team in the championship.
meanings.sent5: The radio host trumpeted the benefits of the new health initiative to all listeners.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, clear sound like a trumpet.
meanings.sent1: The elephant trumpeted loudly in the zoo, catching everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The brass section of the orchestra trumpeted a majestic fanfare.
meanings.sent3: The toddler trumpeted happily when she saw her favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The ship's horn trumpeted across the harbor, signaling its departure.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock trumpeted its shrill sound, waking up the entire household.

meanings.sent1: The company trumpeted the achievements of its employees in the annual report.
meanings.sent2: The author's fans trumpeted her latest book as a masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The chef trumpeted the new menu items, enticing customers to try them.
meanings.sent4: The politician trumpeted his plans for positive change in the community.
meanings.sent5: The coach trumpeted the team's hard work and dedication during the championship game.
